publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-248 Karen Gillon: Marks and Spencer-That the Parliament regrets the decision of Marks and Spencer PLC to outsource supplies for clothing from quality Scottish companies such as Daks-Simpson Ltd and Bairds to offshore suppliers; recognises the considerable skills, dedication, commitment and expertise of the workforce at Daks-Simpson Ltd and Bairds, and calls upon the Scottish Executive and the economic development agencies to work with these companies to identify new business opportunities and safeguard jobs. Supported by: Bristow Muldoon*
S1M-248 Marks and Spencer (lodged on 2 November 1999) Janis Hughes*, David Mundell*
S1M-248 Marks and Spencer (lodged on 2 November 1999) Dr Elaine Murray*, Fiona Hyslop*, Margaret Jamieson*, Mrs Mary Mulligan*, Cathy Jamieson*

S1M-248 Karen Gillon: Marks and Spencer—That the Parliament regrets the decision of Marks and Spencer PLC to outsource supplies for clothing from quality Scottish companies such as Daks-Simpson Ltd and Bairds to offshore suppliers; recognises the considerable skills, dedication, commitment and expertise of the workforce at Daks-Simpson Ltd and Bairds, and calls upon the Scottish Executive and the economic development agencies to work with these companies to identify new business opportunities and safeguard jobs. Supported by: Bristow Muldoon, Janis Hughes, David Mundell, Dr Elaine Murray, Fiona Hyslop, Margaret Jamieson, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Cathy Jamieson, Scott Barrie*, Marilyn Livingstone*, Malcolm Chisholm*, Johann Lamont*, Gordon Jackson*, Ms Margaret Curran*, Mr John McAllion*, Paul Martin*, George Lyon*, Allan Wilson*, Maureen Macmillan*, Mr Duncan McNeil*R, Pauline McNeill*, Elaine Smith*, Rhoda Grant*, Cathy Peattie*, Euan Robson*, Mr Mike Rumbles*, Ian Jenkins*, Tavish Scott*, Tricia Marwick*, Des McNulty*
S1M-248 Marks and Spencer (lodged on 2 November 1999) Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-248 Marks and Spencer (lodged on 2 November 1999) Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Alex Neil*
